g.text: 2.1.2. Reaction of Metal Hydrides and AluminumSalts
Another example of lithiumalanate synthesis is the reaction of LiHwith AlCl
under an atmosphere of dry nitrogen [
This type of reaction is known as “the Schlesinger method”. Despite the simplicity of this reaction,
it requires the use of milled LiH(ﬁner than 100 mesh). Additionally, this reaction requires an excess of
]. The same reaction outline of Equation (5)
can be used with NaHor KH, and AlCl
these reactions need the use of Al(C
as a catalyst for the reaction with NaH, and C
AlH as a catalyst for the reaction with KH [
The same type of reaction can be applied to M
No catalyst is used in the last example.
Some materials are obtained rather as THF adducts when this solvent is used [
the THF adducts cannot be puriﬁed (elimination of THF) without the decomposition of the alanate.
The use of protective atmospheres during synthesis can improve the yield of the reactions [
A general reaction could be described as:
Some of the references for this kind of synthesis are rather old. Initially, this synthesis procedure
was not considered for hydrogen storage purposes.
Several alanates having one cation or bi-cation have been produced by the metathesis reaction
and metal halides in organic solvents, such as THF or Et
One practical reason for this is that NaAlH
are the only commercially available alanates.
This type of reaction dates back from1950, fromthe work of Wiberg and Bauer [
Mg, Ca, or other metals, and X
Reactions of this type normally are conducted under reﬂuxing conditions fromcryogenic to room
temperature for several hours or even days. The products usually are adducts of the solvent used,
and subsequent operations of puriﬁcation and drying are required.
During the 80s of the last century, the mechanical milling sped up the development of hydrogen
storage. We refer both to the study of materials (number of newmaterials), andthe materials themselves
summarizes some of the most important ideas around the mechanical
milling that are relevant for the hydrogen storage.
